nodes.bodyText: I would throw an unsupported operation exception instead since this should never be called.  (or alternatively remove the if condition  before calling this method.
Yeah, it should never be called. I added throwing of an unsupported operation exception.
use checkArgument instead since it refers to one of the function arguments
Merge this line with the previous one
In Presto code base, either put all parameters in one line, or one parameter each line.
This line is huge, I changed to one line per param.
This is doing more than decryption.  I would call this decryptAndCombineFileStatistics or something.
I updated the method name. Meanwhile I'm looking into pulling encryption keys into the OrcReader.
Is fileStripes guaranteed to be non-empty?
No, I misread the condition in OrcReader.validateEncryption, we never hit this block because of that issue when Presto fails to write an empty encrypted file. Fixed.
let's extract encryptionGroup.getNodes() to a variable so we don't call it twice
if !encryptionGroup.getKeyMetadata().isPresent() is true then encryptionGroup.getKeyMetadata().get() will blow up --  Perhaps the check is inverted?
Do we have any unit tests that test this method? If not, can we add some

> will blow up
I'm surprised that neither IntellIj nor findbugs/spotbugs cought it. Fixed.
> Do we have any unit tests that test this method? If not, can we add some
I think it never hit this broken condition because of a bug in the AbstractRecordReader logic. Also Presto doesn't write keys into the footer encryption group which makes it hard to create a test case w/o doing some custom manipulations with files.

createOrcPredicate is used by OrcTester and is used by all block tests. Is there any reason you set the noFileStats to false for all the tests? The tests could be on other formats like ORC, are they all without file stats?

It seems that this condition was only used for DWRF files to skip the file stats check because Presto didn't read DWRF file stats. I enabled file stats for DWRF and removed this condition.
> The tests could be on other formats like ORC, are they all without file stats?
That's the problem with negative names, noFileStats = false actually means to test the file stats. It makes more sense to me to completely remove this parameter because it's now always false, what do you think?
